metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41164 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: CKEditor4 is an open source WYSIWYG HTML editor. In affected versions a vulnerability has been discovered in the Advanced Content Filter (ACF) module and may affect all plugins used by CKEditor 4. The vulnerability allowed to inject malformed HTML bypassing content sanitization, which could result in executing JavaScript code. It affects all users using the CKEditor 4 at version < 4.17.0. The problem has been recognized and patched. The fix will be available in version 4.17.0.

notes.Note: sbeattie> embedded copies of ckeditor are in ldap-account-manager, rt4, and rt5 litios> no specific patch was found

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ckeditor3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ldap-account-manager package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
request-tracker4 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
